entry.title: Indonesia Billing & IV with Down Payment, down payment needs to reduce the tax base
entry.content:
Dears,

In Indonesia , any down payments you receive from customers must be reflected in the tax invoice that is generated for the final invoice. The down payment needs to be shown on the invoice to reduce the tax base.  That was indicated in SAP.help and requried by our client in Indonesia as well.

But I can't figure it our in system(S4/HANA), especially in MIRO to verifiy such a invoice.  I've got a sample invoice that states the tax base to calculate VAT is PO net minus Down Payment, but i can't realize it by MIRO. Could anyone pls advise here or provide some related document/info? anything like Notes/Correction for local function was missed ?

 

Thanks,

entry.title: Unleashing Creativity with Cloud-Based AI Apps: 2025 Premium Hub CoE High School Summer Orientation
entry.content:
This summer, a group of bright high school students embarked on an exciting journey at SAP's week-long STEM orientation program. This program focused on harnessing the power of cloud-based AI apps using the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), providing students with practical, hands-on learning experiences using low-code/no-code tools.

 

 

Building the Foundation with SAP Build Apps:

The week kicked off with students getting an introduction into SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and Artificial Intelligence at SAP. A key component of the learning experience was SAP Build Apps, a powerful tool within SAP BTP that enabled students to design and develop applications using a low-code/no-code approach. This tool simplified the app creation process, allowing students to focus on functionality and creativity rather than complex coding.

The primary task was to create a barcode scanner application using SAP Build Apps. This app scanned barcodes and retrieved detailed information about food items from the Open Food Facts API, a free and open database of food product information. This integration taught students how to connect their applications to external data sources, demonstrating the potential of combining SAP BTP with other digital resources.

Adding a Generative AI Twist:

The real magic happened when students were introduced to Google Gemini, allowing them to enhance their applications with Generative AI capabilities. By integrating AI into their apps, students were able to analyze the health aspects of food ingredients, transforming simple barcode scanners into intelligent, interactive applications. This exercise encouraged students to think critically about how AI can enhance user experiences and provide valuable insights.

Showcasing Innovation:

As the week progressed, students eagerly worked on their projects, each bringing their own flair to the task. They showcased the culmination of their hard work in a demo session held on Friday, presenting their enhanced applications. It was inspiring to see how each participant leveraged the tools and guidance provided to create something truly remarkable.

Reflecting on the Experience:

The orientation week was not just about building apps; it was about fostering a spirit of innovation and collaboration. The students left with more than just technical skills; they gained confidence and a deeper understanding of how technology can be used to solve real-world problems.

The feedback from participants has been overwhelmingly positive, with many expressing how the program has sparked a new interest in technology and AI.

Here's what one of our students had to say about their unforgettable experience:

“Thank you so much for organizing such a great practicum experience at SAP. I really enjoyed the week and learned a lot, especially”during the project work and all the tours. Getting to explore the SAP Build platform and contribute to the barcode scanner project was a really cool experience, and it helped me understand how tech is used in the real world.

I also really appreciated how friendly and supportive everyone was throughout the week. The tours of the MCC and Smart Factory, as well as the leadership talk on the last day, were really inspiring and gave me a better idea of the kinds of roles I might want to explore in the future.

Thanks again for the opportunity, and I’m really grateful for the experience!”- Mehul Vijayvergiya

 

Looking Forward:

This orientation was a testament to the power of education and technology in shaping the minds of tomorrow's innovators. As we continue to provide these opportunities, we are excited to see how these young minds will contribute to the ever-evolving tech landscape.

 

Thank you to Balaji Rao Gaddam for sponsoring and hosting this year’s event.  

Thank you to the SAP colleagues who coordinated this year’s Summer Orientation and made it a success!

 

Ashok Kumar M & Megan Rech (Leads) Nkem Ohanenye (Project Co-Coordinator), Savannah Cole (HR) and volunteers and speakers. A huge thank you to our onsite team coordinators Nkem Ohanenye, Sean David, Prasad Gagarani, and Manas Trivedi.


And a special thanks to the SAP speakers and colleagues who shared their expertise!
John Astill (D-Shop Demo), Evan Taylor (STAR Internship Program), Justin Lynch (SAP Overview & Career Development), George Harwood (NSQ Campus Tour), Haibo Huang & Vivek RR (Artificial Intelligence Experts), SooWan Bag and Peter Yeung (Industry 4.0 Center Tour), Manuel Gruber, Julia Cuellar, Rob, Bulusu, Hubertus Oswald (MCC Presentation).

 

#STEM #PremiumHubCoE

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 10.0 FP2105 DI API ProductionOrderType always 'S'
entry.content:
Hi @Baranyai_Csaba ,

I guess that your assumption is incorrect.

  • Type 'S' means Standard.
  • Type 'P' means Special.
  • Type 'D' means Disassembly

The same can be observed in SAP Business One client.

Kind regards,

ANKIT CHAUHAN

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: mass change goal plan status
entry.content:
Hi user116,

Currently, there is no feature available to directly mass update goal plan statuses for all users at once. This can only be managed at the individual template level, not across multiple templates simultaneously.

entry.title: SAP object dependencies procedure to calculate the current system date
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I wanted to check if the following requirement can be met with the help of using SAP object dependencies procedure.

The requirement is to calculate the 'AGE' of the Equipment in number of years.

We have created a characteristic 'AGE' with UOM ' Year' and assigned to the required Equipment class.

To populate the 'AGE' we have the logic = Current Date - Equipment Start up date (This has been also created as a characteristic which automatically populates the value from the EQUI-INBDT table and assigned to the same Equipment class)

The challenge we are facing is how we can determine the 'Current Date' in the procedure?

I am seeking help to get the guidance how we can write the above logic in SAP SAP object dependencies procedure?

Please don't advise any custom ABAP solution or creating a function module as we wanted to avoid ABAP customization here.

Any help will be much appreciated. 

Thanks

Rahul

PLM Enterprise Asset Management (EAM)/Plant Maintenance (PM) PLM Variant Configuration SAP Variant Configuration and Pricing MAN Production Planning (PP) SAP ERP, add-on for embedded production planning and detailed scheduling

entry.title: Re: Business Rules in Custom Task- Onboarding 2.0 SAP Suc...
entry.content:
Hi @karthik1gobburu ,

  • At the moment we do not support Business Rule application within the custom task configuration.
  • This is a product limitation in the current Onboarding Feature.

KBA reference - 3475492 - [Onboarding] Custom Task fields not auto populating as per created business rule - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Indonesia Billing & IV with Down Payment, down paymen...
entry.content:
Check this SAP Help document Down Payment and Down Payment Request 

Key points from this page:

  • You can define down payment categories (mandatory, voluntary, not active) at PO header or item level.
  • When you post an incoming invoice in MIRO, the system proposes all down payments that were posted with reference to the PO and not yet cleared.
  • The system then posts a down payment clearing document together with the invoice document.
  • This ensures that the final invoice amount is reduced by the down payment amount.

entry.title: Re: "Enabling Additional Functionalities for Internal Hir...
entry.content:
Hi @prasad1315,

When you enable the switch "Enabling Additional Functionalities for Internal Hires in Onboarding ", only the internal Hire context is used for triggering email. Other context if its set to Yes or No, will not be considered. So even when you keep the context as Yes for onboarding the business rule will still work. 

 

Thank you,

Regards,

Tabassum

entry.title: Remove Partnership Basics from specific users SAP for Me
entry.content:
When we create an S-User, the "Partnership Basics" permission is automatically granted to users, and even after it's created, it can't be removed. This is causing problems because users are having access to things they shouldn't have. Could we remove specific users from Partnership Basics and prevent it from being automatically granted to new users?
 
They're also getting Partner Management in Important Functions and we don't want that.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Remove Partnership Basics from specific users SAP for Me
entry.content:
Regarding to your request, please refer to KBA 1271517 - Important Contact descriptions and how to view/change S-users with important functions - SAP for Me

Abstract below information for your reference:

To add/remove partner roles and authorizations for S-user IDs, the company's Partner Security Manager (S-user) must make the changes in the SAP Partner Portal according to KBA 2609123. 

If customer is a partner account and needs help maintaining their company's S-user partner authorizations or their administrators -- or there are no Partner User Administrator who can do these tasks -- contact SAP Partner Support using the "Get Support" on the partner "Get assistance" dashboard.

entry.title: List of Employee Central & Employee Central Payroll Guide Updates for the 2H 2025 Release
entry.content:
In SAP SuccessFactors User Assistance, we’ve been working on improving your information experience.

Latest People Profile

We have made more enhancements to the latest People Profile, including redesigned Editing UI and History UI. For more information, refer to Latest People Profile.  

Employment Guide Moved

We listened to your feedback and have now merged the Implementing and Managing the Employment Lifecycle (from Hiring to Termination) guide into the Implementing Employee Central Core guide.

However, any saved links will redirect you to the new guide location.

In addition, based on feedback from our partners, we have added a new topic to better explain the connections between events, event reason, and employee status. 

For more information, refer to System Behavior for Events, Event Reasons, and Employee Status.   

Understanding Employee Central Settings

We have added a new topic to the Employee Central Core guide to understand more details about the features you can enable in your system. We have added more information about dependencies between the settings as well as links to the related guides. For more information, refer to Help with Employee Central Settings.

Understanding Employee Central Position Management Permissions

We have added a new topic to the Implementing Position Management guide to help you understand the permissions that admins and managers need. For more information, refer to Permissions for Position Management | SAP Help Portal.

Your Feedback on Position Management Documentation

We listened to your feedback and improved the topic, Moving Positions When Changing An Employee's Manager Assignment | SAP Help Portal, by including an example and clarifying the instructions.

 

List of Guide Changes to the Employee Central Page

Merged Guides for Employee Central

Guide

Change

Details

Implementing and Managing the Employment Lifecycle (from Hiring to Termination)

Merged

This guide is now merged into the Implementing Employee Central Core guide.

 

List of Changes to the Employee Central Payroll Page

New Guides for Employee Central Payroll

Guide

Change

Details

Implementing Payroll Control Center for Employee Central Payroll Based on SAP Human Capital Management for SAP S/4HANA

 

New

The documentation for the Payroll Control Center is now available in this guide. We’ve removed the content from the Implementing Employee Central Payroll based on SAP Human Capital Management for SAP S/4HANA.

entry.title: Re: Developing a Customized AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Part 1
entry.content:
Hello @catherine_guang,

Could you please check the expression-based filter is correctly maintained in the Custom CDS View.

If you have an element and selected for the expression-based filter to filter by company code, account type for the custom cds view, check those fields has been maintained correctly with correct field name. 

Replace I_JournalEntryOperationalView with an actual column name (Company Code, Account Type fields).

For example:

If you were trying to use the Account Type from that view, your entry should look like:
I_JournalEntryOperationalView.FinancialAccountType (Assuming Account Type is a field in the target view)

You need to treat I_JournalEntryOperationalView as a view that you associate to, not a column you select.

entry.title: Re: Datasphere backup
entry.content: correct. All you can do is to backup via transport files the metadata and export the data to a second space/tenant/or external DB. No other options exists

entry.title: Re: Invalid path on crystal reports
entry.content:
Hi Yvonne_Hoffmann

Please note this reported scenario can be related to incomplete installation of Crystal Report or can be caused by a mismatch between SAP Business One and Crystal Report versions. 

In this case, please follow all steps from SAP Note 2845037 - Reinstalling SAP Crystal Reports and Associated SAP Business One Components and also make sure the correct CR version is installed as highlighted in SAP Note 2329487 - Crystal Reports for SAP Business One Matrix.

Kind Regards
Nidhi
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 10.0 FP2105 DI API ProductionOrderType always 'S'
Re: replication stuck - how to remove scheduled replication
entry.content:
Hi ,

First, I stopped the replication in DSP. From my experience, sometimes the table is removed and sometimes not from SLT when it is stopped in DSP.  And if it stills remains in SLT, then you can stop it manually in SLT. 

I have stopped it both in DSP and SLT and it still remains in "Scheduled, stopped phase". Which means that I cannot reload the table because it is still available. 

Thanks,

entry.title: SAP Women in Tech Lounge
entry.content:
How will decentralized energy grids change the way we live?
And what does it really take to integrate lifelong learning into our daily lives?

These were the questions we discussed in our #SAPWomenInTech Lounges.

Distributed Energy Resources – The Evolution of the Energy Grid
Together with Dr. Anselma Wörner (Exnaton) and Daniela Haldy-Sellmann (SAP), we explored how decentralized grids and local energy trading are shaping the future.
My takeaway: The energy transition will only succeed if technology, regulation, and society move forward in sync. Innovation alone is not enough – it takes collaboration on all levels.

Lifelong Learning
With Katharina Abernethy (PARSA) and Linda Kirchner (SAP), we discussed that learning goes far beyond trainings – it is a question of mindset.
My takeaway: Growth happens when we step out of our comfort zone, turn mistakes into opportunities, and keep going. Lifelong learning is not a one-time effort but means staying curious and committed – throughout life.

A big thank you to our inspiring speakers, to [name of your manager] for moderating, to Eugen for making the sessions possible at the Experience Studio, to Anton for creating the recap video, and to the SAP WiT team for the great collaboration.

And most of all: thank you to our community. Your questions, your engagement, and your perspectives make the Lounges lively and valuable.

Which ideas or questions come to your mind when you think about decentralized energy grids and lifelong learning?

Let’s spark a discussion together.

#SAPWomenInTech #Parsa #Exnaton

entry.title: Re: CDS Views for SAC models
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question. 

Here's where you find our CDS views:

  • On the the SAP Help Portal, you can find an overview of the available CDS views per area: 

    Virtual Data Model and CDS Views in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • The View Browser app provides comprehensive list of available CDS views, including those released for consumption. You can search using keywords related to your business content needs.
  • On the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, you can search for released CDS views. This platform allows you to filter and find CDS views that are compatible with your needs.
    Kind regards,
    Henrike

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Meets Multi-Tenancy
entry.content:
Introduction

Multitenancy with SAP Build Work Zone - Managed App Router in CEP (Central Entry Point) Mode​

​Since the introduction of the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry environment, managing multitenant applications through the Central Launchpad Service, known as SAP Build Work Zone, has been a significant and continuous challenge.

​As an alternative, multitenant solutions had to rely on the Portal Service supported via a standalone app router.Managing this standalone app router at the individual project or product level to meet all security and compliance standards was a cumbersome task.​

​This approach increased the cost of development and maintenance.​

​With SAP Build Work Zone's support for multitenancy, we can now leverage the out-of-the-box feature benefits of the Managed App Router.​

​Projects and products can shift their focus and energy towards actual business operations.

Pros:​

  • Standard Support for Managed App Router​
  • Easier Maintenance of Security and Reduced Development/Maintenance Efforts​
  • Alignment with One SAP Approach aka Golden Path, Providing a Single-Entry Point for End Users/Customers​
  • With CDM (Common Data Model) Support, Site and Content Maintenance Becomes Simplified​
  • Best fitment for SAP-managed subaccount for end customers.

Cons:​

  •  In the SAP Managed Solution, an SAP Build Work Zone subscription is a prerequisite in the subscriber subaccount.​

Step-by-Step Guide/Walkthrough of SBWZ in Multitenant Account in CEP Mode

➢ Build Time Activity - Site Content Creation via CDM.json

➢ Easy Maintenance of Site Config, Page/Space, Group/Catalogs

➢ Translation of site content Texts Group, Page/Space via i18n

➢ appId=> sap.app.id mentioned in the manifest.json file

➢ vizId => cross navigation semantic object action in the manifest.json

➢ Add Common Data Model (CDM) as part of MTA Build

➢ Define Common Data Model (CDM) destination – Identified by Business Solution Name defined in

manifest.json “sap.cloud”->“service”

➢ Define runtime destination for launchpad content

➢ Build the MTA application and deploy to the BTP provider subaccount.

➢ Verify the CDM and runtime destination in provider sub-account

➢ Export the destination

➢ Subscriber subaccount -> subscribe to the multitenant application

➢ Import the CDM & run time destination in subscriber subaccount

➢ CDM destination in subscriber subaccount, update client secret reference from provider subaccount.

➢ Runtime destination changes the URL to point to the subscriber subaccount subdomain.

➢ Subscriber subaccount -> SAP Build Work Zone subscription/entitlement should be there

➢Create a content channel in the subscriber subaccount Site Manager -> Content Channels by using the imported RT (runtime) and CDM (design time) destination.

➢ Once it is created, refresh it to reflect the site content in the subscriber subaccount.

➢ In Subscriber subaccount BTP cockpit map, the Role Collection [created by content channel] to Technical Role

➢ Assign the CIS/IAS user Group to Role Collection

 

➢ In Site Manager, a site is created automatically after channel creation/refresh

Configuring Multiple UI5 Apps in a Single Site Using CDM.json [CDM Merge] in CEP Mode

➢ Add the CDM file in your second UI5 app, having the same site ID but different groups, catalogs and roles.

➢ Keep the business solution name the same in manifest.json file

➢Deploy the app, subscribe, re-import destinations, update roles, and refresh the content channel. The site stays the same, but "Go to Site" shows all groups and catalogs.

entry.title: SVHC Reporting using a Group of Compliance Requirements
entry.content:
Hello All,

We have a requirement where we want to create our own Compliance Requirement, containing a bunch of CR provided by SAP. For example a "Restricted" composite CR would contain several CR that restrict placing substances on the market (eg REACH Annex XIV or XVII but also some Chinese and other countries lists).

For this we want to have a capability to create CR which has  various Regulations - EU, China, etc. And we want to then execute the CR on a substance to see if it would come bac as "Restricted" for at least one of them.
Then we want to evaluate products based on their substances' Compliance Requirements. 

Please advise on how we can manage this leveraging most of the available Product Compliance functionalities, creating a composite CR that would just be for monitoring, not blocks.

entry.title: Restricting Marketability Checks to only few Compliance Requirements
entry.content: We are evaluating a large number of Compliance Requirements for each Product and based on the setup, it is likely that they come back as Restricted, due to the worse case approach of the marketabiliy assessment for a country. We are concerned of overwhelming product stewards with too many alerts or blocks and would like to filter out which CR among the prupose would trigger a marketability check and subsequent alert or block, for example only these related to inventory status.

entry.title: Re: Multiple Functional Modules
entry.content:
If you expand from SD into TM (Transportation Management), EWM (Extended Warehouse Management), and GTS (Global Trade Services):

Advantages

  • You become an end‑to‑end logistics process expert: from order capture (SD) → warehouse operations (EWM) → transportation planning (TM) → cross‑border compliance (GTS).
  • High demand: Many S/4HANA transformation projects look for consultants who can bridge across these modules instead of hiring 3–4 separate specialists.
  • Strong career branding: “SAP Logistics Consultant” is a premium niche, especially in manufacturing, retail, automotive, and global supply chain industries.
  • You’ll be closer to business process consulting and solution architecture roles.

Challenges

  • Steep learning curve: Each module is deep in its own right.
  • You’ll need to prioritize (e.g., SD + EWM first, then TM, then GTS).
  • Requires strong client‑facing and requirements gathering skills, since logistics processes are highly cross‑functional.


If you add ABAP to your SD expertise:

Advantages

  • You can design solutions and also prototype/customize them yourself.
  • You’ll bridge the gap between functional and technical teams, which makes you very valuable in smaller or fast‑moving projects.
  • Easier to move into solution architect or product owner roles later, since you understand both business and system internals.

Challenges

  • You’ll be competing with career ABAP developers who have much deeper coding experience.
  • The market increasingly values functional consultants with integration knowledge over functional consultants who “also code.”
  • You may risk being seen as “jack of all trades” unless you position yourself carefully.

Having said that, if you ask me how to decide, if your passion is business processes, supply chain, and logistics, go the multi‑module functional route. If you enjoy system logic, debugging, and technical design, and want to be the bridge between business and IT, go techno‑functional. Given you already have 7 years in SD, the natural progression is to expand horizontally into logistics modules. That’s where your experience compounds fastest.

entry.title: BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CREATEMULTIPLE works in SE37 but fails from program — (error in account determinatio
entry.content:
Hello SAP community,

I’m hitting a strange and repeatable issue with BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CREATEMULTIPLE and I need help diagnosing it.

Summary / problem

When I call BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CREATEMULTIPLE from SE37 (manually pasting the exact input values), the billing document and accounting document are created successfully.

When I call the same BAPI from my ABAP program (SE38 / executable) using the same data, the billing document is created but the posting fails accounting determination and I get this message (example output from the program):
 
0200620366 0000000073 0200620366 E Document 199300083 saved (error in account determination)
 
(That is: document is created but “error in account determination”.)

What I have tried

Verified that the input values are identical between the SE37 run and the program run.

Called my custom FM (wrapper) from SE37 with the same payload — it works fine from SE37.

When the same custom FM is executed from SE38 (my program) with the same payload, the error reproduces.

I inspected success / return / error tables returned by the BAPI but still can’t find the root cause (message is generic “error in account determination”).

 

BELOW IS CODE

 LOOP AT it_ztbglsd043 INTO wa_ztbglsd043.
    CLEAR wa_billing.
    wa_billing-bill_date = sy-datum.
    wa_billing-ref_doc   = wa_ztbglsd043-offshore_sales_order.
    wa_billing-doc_number    = wa_ztbglsd043-offshore_sales_order.
    READ TABLE it_vbak INTO wa_vbak WITH KEY
    vbeln = wa_billing-ref_doc.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      wa_billing-ref_doc_ca = wa_vbak-vbtyp.
    ENDIF.
    APPEND wa_billing TO it_billing.
    CLEAR wa_billing.

    DATA lv_posting  TYPE posting_type_ct VALUE 'C' .
    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CREATEMULTIPLE'
*****    CALL FUNCTION 'ZFMINSD008'
      EXPORTING
        posting       = lv_posting
        testrun       = ''       
      TABLES
        billingdatain = it_billing
        errors        = it_errors
        return        = it_return
        success       = it_success.

entry.title: How to Track Data Changes in RAP and Change Log Mechanism in RAP.
entry.content:
hi, 

A change log table alone can be used to track data modifications without storing full historical snapshots. The main table contains the active business data, while the change log table records only the metadata of each change, such as the key fields of the affected record, change type (insert, update, delete), user, and optionally the reason for change.  

 During the RAP save sequence, determinations in the behavior implementation capture these details before the transaction is committed and insert them into the change log table. This approach provides a lightweight audit trail that allows you to track when and by whom changes were made, making it suitable for compliance monitoring, reporting, and troubleshooting, while avoiding the storage overhead of a shadow table that keeps the full data history. 

 

Here we see some major key Advantages. 

  • Lower Storage Requirements – Since it stores only metadata (keys, change type, timestamp, user, etc.) instead of full data snapshots, it uses significantly less database space than a shadow table. 
  • Better Performance – Writing smaller log entries reduces the impact on transaction performance compared to saving entire records. 
  • Simplified Design – Only one additional table is needed, making the data model and maintenance simpler. 
  • Faster Reporting on Changes – The log contains concise, relevant details, making it easier to query and generate audit reports. 
  • Regulatory Compliance – Still fulfills many compliance and audit requirements by showing who changed what and when. 

Steps to achieving  the Track Change Log Mechanism in RAP. 

I have create 2 database tables  

  1. For basic details 
  1. Capturing the changes record table 

 

Table 2.

 

 

Step2. 

We have to create root view  on top of the database table. 

 

And we have to create data definition for change log also. 

 

 

Step 3. 

for the basic data definition we have create on metadata extension for front end display. 

 

@Metadata.layer:#CORE 

annotate entity zgiri_i_empl_details 

with  

{ 

@UI.facet: [  

{  

id: 'object', 

label: 'Basic Data', 

type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE, 

purpose: #STANDARD, 

position: 10 }] 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Id' , position: 10 }] 

@UI.identification: [{ label: 'Id' , position: 10 }] 

Id; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Name' , position: 20 }] 

@UI.identification: [{ label: 'Name' , position: 20 }] 

Name; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Department' , position: 30 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'Department' , position: 30 }] 

Department; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CurrKey' , position: 40 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'CurrKey' , position: 40 }] 

CurrKey; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'Salary' , position: 50 }] 

@UI.identification : [{ label: 'Salary' , position: 50 }] 

Salary; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CreatedBy' , position: 60 }] 

CreatedBy; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'CreatedAt' , position: 70 }] 

CreatedAt; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'ChangedBy' , position: 80 }] 

ChangedBy; 

@UI.lineItem: [{ label: 'ChangedAt' , position: 90 }] 

ChangedAt; 

}

 

Step 4. 

 

On top of the basic view we have to behavior definition. 

 

managed implementation in class zbp_giri_i_empl_details unique; 

strict ( 2 ); 
define behavior for zgiri_i_empl_details //alias <alias_name> 

persistent table zgiri_t_emp_det 

lock master 

with additional save 

authorization master ( instance ) 

early numbering 

//etag master <field_name> 

{ 

create ( authorization : global ); 

update; 

delete; 

field ( readonly ) Id; 

mapping for zgiri_t_emp_det 

{ 

ChangedAt = changed_at; 

ChangedBy = changed_by; 

CreatedAt = created_at; 

CreatedBy = created_by; 

CurrKey = curr_key; 

Department = department; 

Id = id; 

Name = name; 

Salary = salary; 

} 

}

 

On top the consumption view i have create behavior definition for consumption view. 

 

projection; 

strict ( 2 ); 

define behavior for zgiri_c_empl //alias <alias_name> 

{ 

use create; 

use update; 

use delete; 

}

Step 5. 

On top the behavior definition we have to create service definition. 

 

@EndUserText.label: 'service definition' 

define service Zgiri_rap_scn_ser { 

expose zgiri_i_empl_details; 

}

Step 6. 

On top the service definition we have to create  service binding. 

 

Step 6. 

I'm implementing logic in this class. 

CLASS lsc_zgiri_i_empl_details DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_saver. 

PROTECTED SECTION. 

METHODS save_modified REDEFINITION. 

ENDCLASS. 

CLASS lsc_zgiri_i_empl_details IMPLEMENTATION. 

METHOD save_modified. 

DATA lt_log TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zgiri_t_ch_logs1. 

DATA lt_log1 TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zgiri_t_ch_logs1. 

IF update-zgiri_i_empl_details iS NOT INITIAL. 

lt_log = CORRESPONDING #( update-zgiri_i_empl_details ). 

LOOP AT update-zgiri_i_empl_details ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_log_update>). 

ASSIGN lt_log[ id = <ls_log_update>-Id ] TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_log_u>) . 

* / NAME UPDATE......................................... 

if <ls_log_update>-%control-Name = if_abap_behv=>mk-on. 

<ls_log_u>-name = <ls_log_update>-Name. 

TRY. 

<ls_log_u>-id = cl_system_uuid=>create_uuid_x16_static( ). 

CATCH cx_uuid_error. 

"handle exception 

ENDTRY. 

APPEND <ls_log_u> TO lt_log1. 
ENDIF. 
ENDLOOP. 
INSERT zgiri_t_ch_logs1 FROM TABLE _log1. 
ENDIF. 

ENDMETHOD. 

ENDCLASS. 
CLASS lhc_zgiri_i_empl_details DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler. 

PUBLIC SECTION. 
PRIVATE SECTION. 

METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION 

IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zgiri_i_empl_details RESULT result. 

METHODS get_global_authorizations FOR GLOBAL AUTHORIZATION 

IMPORTING REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zgiri_i_empl_details RESULT result. 

METHODS earlynumbering_create FOR NUMBERING 

IMPORTING entities FOR CREATE zgiri_i_empl_details. 
ENDCLASS. 

CLASS lhc_zgiri_i_empl_details IMPLEMENTATION. 


METHOD get_instance_authorizations. 

ENDMETHOD. 

METHOD get_global_authorizations. 

ENDMETHOD. 

METHOD earlynumbering_create. 

DATA(lt_entities) = entities. 

DELETE lt_entities WHERE Id IS NOT INITIAL. 

TRY. 

cl_numberrange_runtime=>number_get( 

EXPORTING 

nr_range_nr = '01' 

object = '/DMO/TRV_M' 

quantity = CONV #( lines( lt_entities ) ) 

IMPORTING 

number = DATA(lv_latest_num) 

returncode = DATA(lv_code) 

returned_quantity = DATA(lv_qty) 

). 

CATCH cx_nr_object_not_found. 

CATCH cx_number_ranges INTO DATA(lo_error). 

LOOP AT lt_entities INTO DATA(ls_entities). 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

%key = ls_entities-%key ) 

TO failed-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

%key = ls_entities-%key 

%msg = lo_error ) 

TO reported-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

ENDLOOP. 

EXIT. 

ENDTRY. 

ASSERT lv_qty = lines( lt_entities ). 

* DATA: lt_travel_tech_m TYPE TABLE FOR MAPPED EARLY yi_travel_tech_m, 

* ls_travel_tech_m LIKE LINE OF lt_travel_tech_m. 

DATA(lv_curr_num) = lv_latest_num - lv_qty. 

 

LOOP AT lt_entities INTO ls_entities. 

lv_curr_num = lv_curr_num + 1. 

APPEND VALUE #( %cid = ls_entities-%cid 

ID = lv_curr_num ) 

TO mapped-zgiri_i_empl_details. 

ENDLOOP. 
ENDMETHOD. 
ENDCLASS.

The output. 

 

Im going to update the this value. 

Here the updated value  we can see. 

And we see in the chang log table. 

In conclusion, using a dedicated change log table provides an efficient and practical way to track data modifications without the heavy storage cost of maintaining full historical snapshots. By recording only essential metadata such as key fields, change type, user, and timestamps, it creates a lightweight yet reliable audit trail. Combined with RAP determinations during the save sequence, this approach ensures that all changes are captured before commit, enabling transparency, compliance monitoring, and easier troubleshooting. Overall, it strikes the right balance between auditability and performance, making it a smart choice for scenarios where full data history is unnecessary.

thank you.

entry.title: AUnits steps for RAP
entry.content:
Introduction:
AUnits are unit tests written by ABAP developers to test each functionality of their code. In RAP, AUnits are used to test functionalities such as validations, determinations, actions, and CRUD operations etc. Your AUnits should aim for maximum coverage of your code. It is recommended to follow TDD(Test Driven Development), where you write the test cases first and then implement the logic. This ensures that the test cases are based on the actual requirements and are not influenced by the implementation.

Reference link for TDD: https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-development-tools-user-guide/test-driven-development-with-abap-unit

Basics of AUnits:
Test classes can be either local or global. Unit tests should typically be implemented as local classes within the program object that is being tested. However, you can use global test classes to host reusable logic for unit tests across different programs. In Eclipse ADT, there is a separate environment for managing local test classes.

Reference link: https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/acquire-core-abap-skills/implementing-code-tests-with-abap-unit_b23c7a00-c2e8-406d-8969-b00db3f1fd87

Structure of test class:

*"* use this source file for your ABAP unit test classes
class ltc_zi_lfa1_2 DEFINITION FINAL for
  TESTING RISK LEVEL HARMLESS DURATION SHORT.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
  CLASS-DATA environment TYPE REF TO if_cds_test_environment.
  DATA td_zlfa TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zlfa1 with empty key.
  DATA  act_results type STANDARD TABLE OF zi_lfa1_2 WITH EMPTY KEY.
  CLASS-METHODS class_setup RAISING cx_static_check.
  CLASS-METHODS class_teardown.
  METHODS setup RAISING cx_static_check.
  METHODS prepare_testdata.
  METHODS aunit_for_cds_method FOR TESTING RAISING cx_static_check.
  ENDCLASS.

For Testing: The addition FOR TESTING is used to identify a test class. These are the classes that will be executed when you run ABAPUnit tests. I will explain further how AUnits are triggered and how to execute them.

Risk Level: 

  • CRITICAL: The test changes system settings or customizing data.
  • DANGEROUS: The test changes persistent data.
  • HARMLESS: The test does not change system settings or persistent data.

Duration:

  • SHORT: Execution time is imperceptible, expected to take only a few seconds.
  • MEDIUM: Execution time is noticeable, around a minute.
  • LONG: Execution time is very noticeable, taking more than a minute. 

Methods in Test Classes:

  • Helper Methods: Helper methods are ordinary methods of the test class. They are not called by the ABAP Unit framework. You can use helper methods to structure the code of your test methods. For example, prepare_testdata is a helper method.
  • Test Methods: Test methods are defined with the addition FORTESTING after the method name. Each test method represents one test. The ABAP Unit framework performs this test by calling the corresponding test method. Test methods must not have any parameters. In the above example, aunit_for_cds_method is your test method.

Good Practices:

  • It’s a good practice to have a separate method for each functionality, with no dependencies inside the method. Each method should be treated as a single test case.
  • Always include both positive and negative test cases.

Flow of test case:

CLASS_SETUP
This static method is executed once before the first test of the test class. Use this method for fixtures that are time-consuming to create and for which you are sure the settings will not be changed by any of the test methods. Example: Setting up a test double in the test environment.

SETUP
This instance method is called before each test of the test class. Use this method for fixtures that you want to create fresh for every test case. Example: Creating an instance of the CUT (Class Under Test).

TEARDOWN
This instance method is called after each test of the test class. Use it to undo changes made in the SETUP method. It is especially important if SETUP modifies persistent data (such as system configuration, customizing, or master data). Example: Clearing test doubles so that each test starts with fresh data.

CLASS_TEARDOWN
This static method is executed once after the last test of the test class. Use it to clean up or destroy the test environment set up in CLASS_SETUP, once all tests are completed. Example: Tearing down the overall test environment.

To run ABAP units execute ABAP Unit Test. This will trigger the test class. If you run ABAP application it will not trigger test class.

Test double framework:
As I mentioned earlier, your unit tests should check only the functionality(CUT – Code Under Test) that you have written the test case for. However, in real-world scenarios, each component is usually interlinked and not standalone.

What is the issue?
To explain this, let’s take an example. Suppose you are testing an instance authorization method. This method is dependent on an authorization object. If the AUTH-CHECK of the authorization object fails, the instance authorization method will also fail. This means that even if your instance authorization method is working correctly, the test could still fail due to its dependency. Ideally, the failure of a dependency should not cause your unit test to fail when you are testing the functionality of the CUT itself.

Examples of dependencies in RAP

  • Instance and global authorizations: Dependency on authorization checks.
  • SAVE / SAVE_MODIFIED methods: Dependency on function modules or BAPIs.
  • Determinations: You might use EML of another BO, making your BO dependent.
  • Validations: Your CDS view could be a dependency; if the required record is not present in the CDS view, the validation might fail. And there are many more such cases.

Solution — Test Double Framework
So, how do we overcome this? Instead of relying on dependencies that are beyond our control, we mock or stub these dependencies. This allows us to influence how they behave and interact during testing, thereby avoiding test case failures due to external dependencies. This approach is implemented using the Test Double Framework.

The main purpose of both mock and stub is to not to test from actual data but rather a fake data that we can configure. Because our test class will fail if its dependent on real time data as it will be different in different
environment.

  1. STUB: Stubs just provide predefined response.
  2. MOCK: You design how the interaction should be. Like if you provide this value this is how the output would be and also verify it.

I will now discuss in detail how we write ABAP Unit tests with a simple example.

Requirement:
Write a positive test case to check the validation check_country, which should throw an exception if we pass a country code with more than2characters. Also, remove the dependency on the CDS view.

Steps:
Identify CUT and dependencies
Here, I have taken a validation method as an example for testing. The CUT(Code Under Test) is the validation method, and the dependency is the CDS view. So, I will use the STUB methodology to configure the response of the CDS view.

Creation of test class
Once you create the test class, you need to add it as a friend in the local handler class (since we are testing a validation). This is necessary because all the methods of the local handler class are inside the private section and cannot be accessed directly.

Inside the test class
I have already explained the use of SETUP, CLASS_SETUP, TEARDOWN, andCLASS_TEARDOWN earlier, so I will not repeat that here.
In this example, validate_check_country is our test method. I have added a test double for the CDS view, because the validation should be tested using the mock data we provide, not the actual data.
I create the mock data and insert it, so that the CDS view returns this data. Now, when we pass parameters to the validation, we can check if we get a value in reported, since we have provided a country code with 3 characters.

Note: This is just an example program. Typically, mocking, adding mock data, and different functionalities would be implemented in separate methods. It is not a good practice to combine everything into a single method. Each method should have only one responsibility. Here, I have combined them solely to showcase the concept.

class ltc_lfa1_validation IMPLEMENTATION.
    METHOD class_setup.
      cds_environment = cl_cds_test_environment=>create( i_for_entity = 'zi_lfa1_2' ).
     ENDMETHOD.
     METHOD setup.
       CREATE object cut for testing.
       cds_encironment->clear_doubles( ).
       ENDMETHOD.
     method validate_check_country.
       data: lfa1_mock_data type STANDARD TABLE OF zlfa1.
       data(system_uuid) = cl_uuid_factory=>create_system_uuid( ).
       DATA(uuid_x16) = system_uuid->create_uuid_x16( ).
       select * FROM zi_lfa1_2 into TABLE @DATA(lt_result).
         lfa1_ock_data = VALUE#( ( 
                                  Lifnr = uuid_x16 Name1 = 'Raj' Land1 = 'Ind' ) )
       cds_environment->insert_test_data( i_data = lfa1_mock_data ).
         select * from zi_lfa1_2 into TABLE @DATA(lt_result).
           i_keys = value #( ( Lifnr = uuid_x16 ) ).
           cut-> check_country( exporting key = i_keys
                                changing failed = c_failed reported = c_reported ).
           cl_abap_unit_assert=>assert_not_initial( act = c_reported msg = 'failed' ).
       ENDMETHOD.
       method teardown.
         cds_environment->destroy( ).
         ENDMETHOD.
         METHOD class_teardown.
           cds_environment->clear_doubles( ).
           ENDMETHOD.
    ENDCLASS.

Conclusion: Writing ABAP unit test in RAP ensures that the underling business logic is robust and reliable.  Structured unit test not only improve code quality and reliability but also facilitate easier maintenance and refactoring.

entry.title: Re: 物料的特殊保质期
entry.content:
Hello @Rim3 

Thank you for your questions about special shelf-life requirements. Below is how SAP handles material shelf life, and how we can address your one-month maximum for the P1 rule.

Batch basics for raw material A – enable batch management and specify Total Shelf Life as 180 days; record Date of Manufacture (LOBM_HSDAT) and SLED (LOBM_VFDAT) on batches. Optionally, set Minimum Remaining Shelf Life to manage GR.SAP Help Portal-Supply Chain

Develop a batch search strategy specifically for P1 production components, ensuring that when producing P1, the system only selects batches that comply with the freshness rule, such as

Remaining Shelf Life (LOBM_RLZ) ≥ 150 days (180 − 30), or HSDAT ≥ today − 30 days using a date characteristic.
Assign the strategy so it applies only to component A in P1 (through production batch determination and, where necessary, BOM item classification, which takes priority  SAP Support Portal-Batch Determination in Producti Leave P2/P3/P4 standard – don’t assign the strict search strategy for those headers; they’ll accept any in-date batch. SAP Help Portal

Another helpful reference

Set up batch determination in S/4HANA Cloud (step-by-step blog). SAP Community-Set Up Batch Determination in Manufacturing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: T-code S_P00_07000134 not run continuously, Withholdi...
entry.content:
Yes why it is behaving like that is because the report reads data from WITH_ITEM (withholding tax line items) and groups them by vendor code and withholding tax type. Document number is not the primary selection/aggregation field in the standard program. This is by design: the report is intended for statutory reporting (e.g., certificates, returns) where vendor totals matter more than individual FI documents.

In ECC, alternative reports available are

  • RFWTIN20 / RFWTIN30 (depending on country version) sometimes provide more granular reporting.
  • RFWT0010 (Withholding Tax Line Items) can be run directly to see document-level detail.

entry.title: Re: Archiving and Deleting Data from OpenText Tables in S...
entry.content:
Hello,

Indeed the archiving object is /OPT/DOC

This is chapter 'Data archiving configuration' in the configuration guide.

We are using it since a bit more than a year. This is really a must for VIM as the data storage of VIM is terrible (and not efficient). For example, the amount of data generated by VIM in CDPOS is huge (there's an option to change this behaviour but the impact of reporting is not clear).

entry.title: Re: [SAP BTP Onboarding Series] Joule – Getting Started with Joule and SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hi @SzWS 

RE "if WorkZone is needed before Joule?". My answer would be yes.  SAP BTP “Build Work Zone, standard edition” is required to run Joule. Joule can only interact with one SAP Build Work Zone instance.  SAP Build Work Zone is NOT free - although Joule is.  You need Workzone to set up the channels (in my case S/4 and SFSF) in its Channel Manager.  Workzone seems expensive if you are only using it for Joule.  IMO Joule is not worth the work zone fee - but that is another conversation.

entry.title: Re: To all SAP expert, can i combine multiple delivery or...

entry.title: Re: SVHC Reporting using a Group of Compliance Requirements
entry.content: What is your current SAP environment?

entry.title: Re: Tax code not possible to update in PO
entry.content:
Yes — your understanding is correct. Here’s why:

  • In MM Purchasing, the tax code (field EKPO-MWSKZ) can be entered manually by the user, unless it is being controlled by the condition technique.
  • When you use condition type NAVS (non‑deductible tax) in the PO pricing procedure, the tax code is derived automatically from the tax procedure and condition records.
  • In this setup, the system locks the tax code field in the PO item so that users cannot overwrite it manually. This is by design, to ensure consistency between FI tax calculation and MM pricing.

entry.title: Re: SVHC Reporting using a Group of Compliance Requirements

entry.title: How to get assignmentEndDate field to Variable Pay Assignment Details section
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CREATEMULTIPLE works in SE37 but fail...
entry.content:
When SE37 works but SE38 fails on the same payload, the difference is almost always in update task behavior, exits/requirements executed in the billing creation, or derivations that depend on the call context.

Some root causes are

  • Update task error: FI posting fails in update (check SM13 for details).
  • Exits/requirements: Custom logic in billing/account determination exits behaves differently outside VF01 (e.g. SY‑TCODE checks).
  • Missing org/pricing data: Billing type, sales org, or account assignment groups not fully derived in your program.
  • Account determination (VKOA): Required combination missing, or wrong account key triggered.
  • Commit handling: Missing/incorrect BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT or premature commits.
  • Authorizations/roles: Background run user lacks FI posting or CO assignment defaults.

What you can do is with minimal experiment to pinpoint the difference, perform the below steps

  1. Run your SE38 program in dialog with your user; capture the billing number; check SM13 and VF02 analysis.
  2. Run the exact same program with billing type explicitly set in BILLINGDATAIN; re-check.
  3. Temporarily deactivate any custom exits that depend on SY-TCODE for a test in QA; if posting succeeds, refactor the exit to be BAPI-safe.
  4. Compare XKOMV and KOMK/KOMP data populated during BAPI vs. VF01 using debugging breakpoint in RV60AFZZ.

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hello Chris,

thank you for answer.

I tried it with your recommended settings, but the dunning note is not printed when there is no mail address. The system is not jumping to the second rule unfortunately.

Here is the Job Log:

Step 002 started (program SAPF150D2, variant &0000000000072, user ID CB9980000023) 00 550 S
26.09.2025 07:39:53 > Start print phase FM 797 S
26.09.2025 07:40:00 > Dunning printout D 0001000015: FM 458 S
26.09.2025 07:40:00 No output possible for output item '1' due to inconsistencies. APOC_OR_MESSAGES 260 S
26.09.2025 07:40:00 Item '1': no email recipient has been maintained. APOC_OR_MESSAGES 138 S
26.09.2025 07:40:00 Application: FI-FI, printing technique: SAP Cloud Platform Forms by Adobe (OM), form name: FM 513 S
26.09.2025 07:40:00 Dunning notice (Druckauftrag) for a/c D 0001000015, dunning level 2 has not been created FM 514 S
26.09.2025 07:40:00 1 dunning notices were read, of which 1 are to be sent. FM 215 S
26.09.2025 07:40:00 0 dunning notices were created (print/e-mail requests)

Seems like the system does not jump to the second rule.

Do you have any advice?

Kind regards

Fabian

entry.title: Re: Customer Group and Supplier/Customer Region fields no...
entry.content:
Please note Customer Group and Supplier/Customer Region are attributes from the Business Partner master data. In the Universal Journal (ACDOCA), only certain fields are updated at posting time. Not every BP attribute is transferred into the accounting document. These two fields are not part of the standard FI interface for most postings. Unless the posting logic explicitly passes them, they remain empty in the G/L line item view.

What this means is the fields are visible in the app because they are part of the generic CDS view behind the app. But they will only show values if the posting source (e.g. SD billing, MM invoice) actually passes those attributes into ACDOCA. For most standard postings, Customer Group and Supplier/Customer Region are not mapped into the journal entry, so they stay blank.

If your business reporting needs these fields, check whether you can use standard dimensions like Company Code, Segment, Profit Center, or Partner fields instead. For customer/vendor reporting, consider apps like Customer Line Items or Supplier Line Items, which pull directly from subledger and show master data attributes more reliably.

entry.title: 3D Viewer SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I am currently creating an App for an "Instruction Guide". In this App all necessary working steps are shown and explained, inculding picture, videos and also 3D Files.

Here's the question: It seems that in Marketplace is no component for showing 3D-Files ( espacially .jt - files) . To solve this, I was binding the jt2go Viewer with an Inline Frame. This is working, but unfortunately, it is always necessary to choose the 3D-Model from the Menu, where all 3D-Models are listed. 

Is there a possible way to show the 3D-Model (.jt) directly in Build Apps?

Many thanks in advance for your help.

Best regards 

Julia

entry.title: Implementing IAS+AMS with BTP Applications
entry.content:
We're implementing IAS+AMS in which the use of XSUAA is eliminated. The implementation goes like this:

1. CAP application with IAS+AMS (separate app)

2. Generate Client ID and Secret in Cloud Identity Service as AMS uses X509 certificate

3. Add a destination for the CAP application with OAuth2UserTokenExchange authentication and using the Client ID and Secret generated

4. Created a Fiori application with managed App Router connected to CAP application via the destination (separate app)

 

The steps followed are here: 

Deploy and Run the Application on Cloud Foundry

[Blog Series] X.509 certificate-based authentication(mTLS) – Demystified

 

With this setup, is it possible to totally not use XSUAA? If not, can you help me understand what should be the correct way of implementing IAS+AMS?

entry.title: ME23N Display Purchase Order: Output is blank
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I need help regarding tcode ME23N. When clicking 'Messages' to print output, there are some PO that has no output type list. These two POs are the exact same, but one works one doesn't. I have tried SAP Note 1955591 but debugger is not triggered for me. New POs do not have this problem anymore, but we still need to print these problematic POs, and I have no idea how to print it without that output list. I tried adding NEU manually in ME22, but I might be doing it wrong as it doesn't work. Can you please help me? Thank you so much in advance.

Side note: Table NAST is empty when I enter application EF, but we are not using BRF+, so I am also stuck at figuring out where the list should come from when debugging.

entry.title: Re: how to start learning SAP - trainings, courses
entry.content:
@sherpy_evening 

I am guessing you have a background in DWH/ETL and Data Analytics in General. To be honest your core skills and concepts will not change in SAP world. It will just get aligned with SAP flavor. You can use learning.sap.com SAP learning site to cross skill your self in areas of your core skills.

  • SAP BTP
  • SAP Analytics 
  • SAP Business Data Cloud
  • SAP datasphere and
  • SAP Analytics Cloud  

Above are some key skillset matching your core expertise.

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil
